title: @Riot, Are we Still Getting Aatrox Changes in Patch 7.7?
body:
Aatrox is one of my favorite top laners, but due to him seeming weak (and me having to fight shitty matchups like {{champion:58}}, {{champion:133}}, and {{champion:6}}) I just haven't played him often. What kind of buffs/changes are you looking into for him, and can we expect them in patch 7.7?  Because right now, you still seem to be ignoring Aatrox.

Some changes could be:
Passive scaling off of bonus AD, or having a high base with no scaling (think Darius)
Attacking jungle monsters while in Hellbent will give Aatrox 10 blood so the passive can last a bit longer. The numbers could be changed or just give him the full refresh on large monsters, but I sort of agree with Riot and the idea that if Aatrox could get his fully passive easily in the jungle, his clear would be too good. (Probably less than {{champion:64}}, though)

replies.body: Alas they didn't decide to buff him in 7.7 lol

I think {{champion:266}}  need more tenacity. 
Just one stun in ~~teamfight ~~ anywhere and his passive + his ult + his W become useless.
He need to AA alot to charge up his passive, but all the bonus AS is only when his passive activated, he cant build both tanky and attackspeed at the same time.
He recover 5% missing health, and it complete useless for him in both jungle cuz his heath always keep stay lower than 40% and he cant gank with that much heath. He is an AA champion, who need certain heath before gank to actually have enough time to attack enemy, and with low heath constant in jungle, he cant gank. (he cant bust, so the amount of heath he have will effect the amount of damage he goin to deal.)
In laning pharse, 5% missing heath per 3 attack is trash cuz during that 3 attack enemy can take half of your heath bar anyway.
I play him in ARAM recently, and holy, i cant even rerive once, even once. Either they bust me so fast that i just Q in, E, then i die. Or i got the charge then they just stun/root me for 3 fking holy seconds and i lost the revive.
Zephyr, but Riot in their infinite wisdom removed it

Sad but true... when you already play an niche hero with unreliable strenghts and riot just comes and takes the few strenghts from your hero. People were complaining about him beeing unreliable (because of his knock up) and riot just makes your passive also unreliable.

Problem solved, aatrox is balanced again!

I'd say they did some right things with the changes, such as making him have more select yet (supposed to be) stronger windows of power, but in turn made him worse against lane bullies and just overall weaker. Main issue seems to be that a lot of Aatrox players (including me) are playing him like old Aatrox and don't know how to adjust. Even once players re-learn him, he will likely still be too weak.
